stories.text:
A tool to build a YAML document from a directory tree containing YAML fragments.

It is useful everywhere complex YAML configuration is employed:

- CI pipelines - Crossplane Compositions - Kubernetes manifests, etc.

For instance, Kubernetes resources can be complex, and in turn make the YAML very verbose.

The aim is to make the document easier to reason about and maintain.

### How to use

`dirty` parses a directory tree:

- a directory is a yaml key - a file (a yaml fragment) has content that is rendered at the current indentation level

Check this Crossplane Composition as example: https://github.com/lucasepe/dirty/tree/main/testdata/platform-ref-aws/cluster/eks

Here the repo link: https://github.com/lucasepe/dirty

Regards, Luca

I've been looking to increase my use of the keyboard, primarily for the productivity gains that I find myself able to reach by consistently sticking to the keyboard. Since I started though, I've noticed fairly uneven support across applications. For example, reviewing my day's worth of meetings and responding to each invitation using Google calendar is very painful to do on the keyboard.

What are people's favorite recommendations of keyboard-based productivity tools?
